Iterate over the years 2002-2023 and read each yearly CSV (water-body-testing-<year>.csv).
For each file keep only rows where the column 'Beach Type Description' equals 'Marine'.
Within those marine rows keep only the ones whose 'Violation' value (lower-cased) is 'yes'.
Compute that year’s exceedance rate as (number of violation rows) divided by (total marine rows).
Collect the yearly rates in a list and take their mean with numpy to obtain the overall average rate for 2002-2023.
Print the average exceedance rate (formatted as a percentage to two decimal places) and also print each year’s individual rate.
